CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;No violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He is a lawyer belonging to ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant was a party to proceedings before ORG to determine where his practice was to be located , a necessary preliminary to any activity in his profession .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the PERSON region ( PERSON ) refused to enter the applicant 's name in the list of practising lawyers . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) upheld that decision . On DATE the Minister of ORG set aside ORG decision . On DATE ORG entered the applicant 's name in the list , but refused to determine a location for his practice on the ground that he had not joined a lawyers ' cooperative ( zespół adwokacki ) in order to carry on his profession .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed , informing ORG that he had been retired since DATE and only worked from time to time . He received no reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to forward to the Minister of ORG his application for permission to carry on his profession as an independent lawyer and to have his practice established in PERSON at the address he indicated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused his application on the ground that he had not made any request for the location of his practice to be designated . According to the Government , the applicant did not appeal against that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a request to have his practice located in ORG ; that request was refused on DATE because there were no places available . On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal by the applicant citing the lack of places and the need to give priority to trainee lawyers .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) , sitting in GPE , set aside the decisions given . It held that ORG had been required to designate a location for the applicant 's practice at the time when it entered his name in the list of members of the Bar , that is on DATE . It also held that when designating the location of the applicant 's practice ORG had a duty to take into account , among other considerations , his state of health .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that the applicant 's practice should be located in PERSON ( QUANTITY from PERSON ) . On appeal , that decision was upheld on DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG once again set aside the decisions given . It held that the governing bodies of the profession , when designating the location of the applicant 's practice , had still not taken into account his state of health , had not explained why , despite the growing number of law practices in the chief town of the region ( PERSON ) , the applicant 's request had not been allowed , and had not explained why requests similar to the applicant 's had been dealt with and granted as a priority .

CARDINAL . NORP That decision was served on ORG on DATE . On DATE ORG asked the applicant to supply information about his professional activity and his state of health . The applicant described his professional activity and stated that he had suffered CARDINAL heart attacks .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to suspend the proceedings to determine where the applicant 's practice was to be located and brought an action to have the applicant declared unfit to carry on his profession on the ground that he had suffered heart attacks . On DATE ORG upheld the decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG , sitting in GPE , of ORG refusal to comply with its decision of DATE . On DATE , according to the ORG , ORG dismissed the complaint as being out of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside the decisions given on DATE and DATE . It observed that the proceedings instituted by ORG could be brought only against a practising lawyer , whereas in the present case , although the applicant 's name had been entered in the list of lawyers , he could not carry on his profession because the location of his practice had not been determined .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG directed the applicant to supply medical certificates attesting to his state of health . Citing ORG decision of DATE , the applicant refused to comply . In consequence , on DATE , ORG determined the location for the applicant 's practice as PERSON ( approximately QUANTITY from ORG ) . It held that there were no medical reasons why the practice should not be located outside the chief town of the region , in which there were too many practising lawyers . On DATE the applicant appealed , and on CARDINAL DATE he complained of ORG continued failure to comply with the decision of ORG , sitting in GPE . On DATE ORG overturned ORG decision . On DATE ORG put off its decision until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , as ORG had not given a ruling within the time allowed , the applicant asked ORG , sitting in PERSON , to compel ORG to reach a decision and “ to take the necessary measures to comply with the instructions given by ORG in its decisions ” . On DATE ORG informed ORG that the applicant 's case was due to be heard at its meeting on DATE . On that date ORG fixed the location of the applicant 's practice in GPE ( QUANTITY from ORG ) , giving him permission to live elsewhere . On appeal , that decision was upheld on CARDINAL DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in PERSON , refused to compel ORG to give a ruling , given that in the meantime ( on DATE ) it had done so . It further noted that the applicant had appealed against the decision concerned . The part of his application containing the request for the necessary measures to be taken to comply with ORG instructions was referred to ORG , sitting in GPE , which had jurisdiction over the matter .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant explained to ORG , sitting in GPE , exactly what it was he was seeking . He distinguished between the following requests : the setting aside of ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ; the imposition of a fine on ORG ; damages for DATE of delay in complying with ORG instructions ( to take the state of his health into account ) ; and a decision on whether he had the right to bring civil proceedings to obtain compensation for the loss he had suffered through the failure to comply with ORG decisions .

CARDINAL . ORG submitted that the application should be refused . Firstly , it pointed out that the applicant was refusing to supply the medical certificates requested , which suggested that he was in good health . Secondly , it informed the court that the applicant worked as a legal adviser in a specific field , so that he was able to carry on an occupation successfully outside the legal profession . It further observed that he was in receipt of an invalidity pension ( uprawnienia rentowe ) . Lastly , it submitted that ORG , the town in which ORG had fixed the location of the applicant 's practice , did not have the requisite number of lawyers . The choice of location had therefore been prompted by concern for the proper administration of justice .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in GPE , allowed only part of the applicant 's claim , setting aside ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . It first observed that ORG had not complied with the orders made in all the decisions it had given up to that date . It referred to the principle that decisions taken by ORG concerning the location of a lawyer 's practice were administrative decisions and therefore came under its jurisdiction . It pointed out that an administrative body could not ignore its legal opinion , since any decision taken in disregard of its orders would be null and void .

ORG also pointed out that an administrative body called upon to deal with a request like the CARDINAL in issue was required to take into account the interest of the individual while protecting the general interest . It emphasised that in the present case ORG decisions gave no valid reason for refusing to allow the applicant to establish his practice in PERSON . In conclusion , it described the proceedings before ORG as unfair , since the applicant had been refused any opportunity to make his case and because ORG had done no more than speculate about his state of health .
CARDINAL . ORG invited the applicant to its meetings on DATE and DATE . He was unable to attend , but presented his apologies .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again fixed the location of the applicant 's practice in GPE . On DATE it annulled the above decision and finally fixed the location of the applicant 's practice in PERSON . On DATE the applicant informed it that he would begin work on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant also referred the matter to ORG ( ORG i GPE – “ the Office ” ) . At the end of the related proceedings , on DATE , the GPE regional anti - monopoly court ( PERSON Antymonopolowy ) dismissed an appeal by ORG against a decision given by the head of ORG PERSON GPE i GPE ) on DATE . After noting that ORG engaged in monopoly practices restraining competition in the service provision market , the court ordered it to abandon the practices concerned . On DATE ORG appealed on points of law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the previous decisions . It ruled that the case concerned the applicant alone and that the conduct of ORG authorities could not be equated with monopoly practices . It held that ORG was not required by its rules to locate a lawyer 's practice in the town of his choice .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of ORG ( the Law of DATE ) provides that the legal opinion expressed in a decision of that court is binding on the administrative body whose action or omission gave rise to the proceedings . The administrative body concerned is required to comply with the opinion until subsequent factual or legal elements cause it to lose its validity or until the decision is set aside as a result of an extraordinary appeal .
CARDINAL . Section DATE of LAW ( the PERSON of CARDINAL DATE ) provides , inter alia :

“ CARDINAL . NORP The regional bar association shall give a decision to enter a lawyer 's name in the list of its members and at the same time shall designate the location of his practice , taking into account the need to ensure appropriate geographical coverage in the supply of legal assistance .

CARDINAL . NORP The regional bar association may decide not to designate the location of the lawyer 's practice in the event of one of the obstacles to carrying on the legal profession referred to in LAW ( CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) and § CARDINAL . ”
CARDINAL . The obstacles to carrying on the legal profession listed in section CARDINAL of LAW are as follows :
“ CARDINAL . A lawyer may not carry on his profession
– if he is bound by a contract of employment ,
– if his spouse works as a judge or prosecutor within the area covered by the regional bar association – in the inquiry and investigation agencies ,
– if he has been declared permanently unfit to carry on the legal profession ,
– if he has been declared unfit ,
– if he has been punished by a suspension from his duties or provisionally suspended from his duties . ”
